prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** **1. Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0094, 0.0094, 0.0075] Proceed with drawing the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. **1.1. Sketch the base of the cylindrical object** Create a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.1125, 0.1125] - Radius: 0.1125 This circle represents the base of the cylindrical object. **1.2. Sketch the top of the cylindrical object** Create a second circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.1125, 0.1125] - Radius: 0.1106 This circle represents the top of the cylindrical object which is slightly smaller than the base. **1.3. Complete the sketch** Close the sketch by connecting the edges of the two circles, forming a continuous outline. This should result in two faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) and two loops (loop\\_1 and loop\\_2). The following step requires scaling the 2D sketch. Apply a scale factor of 0.225 to the entire sketch. Now, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] (no rotation) - Translation vector: [0.0094, 0.0094, 0.0075] (matching the coordinate system) Proceed to extrude the 3D sketch along the z-axis to generate the first part of the CAD model. Use the following parameters for the extrusion: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.7425 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 - Sketch scale: 0.225 (matching the scaling factor used earlier) - Operation: **Create a new solid body** **Part 2 Instructions** **2. Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side with a central hole.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0075] Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. **2.1. Sketch the base of the cylindrical object** Create a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.1219, 0.1219] - Radius: 0.1219 This circle represents the base of the cylindrical object. **2.2. Complete the sketch** Close the sketch by completing the circle. This should result in a single face (face\\_1) and a single loop (loop\\_1). Now, extrude the 3D sketch along the z-axis to generate the second part of the CAD model. Use the following parameters for the extrusion: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0075 - Sketch scale: 1 (no scaling, as the sketch matches the required dimensions) - Operation: **Add or join materials to existing solid** After following these instructions, the resulting CAD model should match the provided description.</description>
